metadata.title: CVE-2019-15847 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - negligible
metadata.description:
The POWER9 backend in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) before version 10 couldoptimize multiple calls of the __builtin_darn intrinsic into a single call,thus reducing the entropy of the random number generator. This occurredbecause a volatile operation was not specified. For example, within asingle execution of a program, the output of every __builtin_darn() callmay be the same.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15847` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cpp-9 - 9.2.1-28ubuntu1
g++-9 - 9.2.1-28ubuntu1
g++-9-multilib - 9.2.1-28ubuntu1
gcc-9 - 9.2.1-28ubuntu1
gcc-9-base - 9.2.1-28ubuntu1

criterions.comment: gcc-9 package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.2.1-28ubuntu1').
gcc-10 package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.2.0-13ubuntu1').
gcc-9-cross package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-9-cross-ports package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-snapshot package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-defaults package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
